body.p: “At Ed. Hoar’s in the evening. I look at one of his slides through a microscope “,” at the infusorial skeletons of the navicula [image 1] and dumb-bell [image 2] infusoria “,” etc. “,” etc. With his microscope I see the heart beating in the embryo fish and the circulations distinctly along the body.”
PE 13, pg. 368 / 25 November 1857-4 June 1858/ NNPM MA 1302:31 / T vol. # XXV / PDF # XVI / JX
